Description: Touro Infirmary, a New Orleans Hospital, agreed to pay the United States $1.75 million to settle allegations that it submitted false claims to the Medicare program.

After it disclosed conduct to the Office of Inspector Genera pursuant to its Corporate Integrity Agreement, Touro Infirmary agreed to pay $427,561.59 for allegedly violating the Civil Monetary Penalties Law by employing an individual that it knew or should have known was excluded from participation in Federal health care programs.
Agency: Health & Human Services Department Office of Inspector General

Description: West Jefferson Medical Center agreed to pay the United States and the State of Louisiana $3.3 million to resolve allegations that the hospital overcharged the Medicaid program.

Info Source: Extracted from a download of OSHA's Enforcment Data downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_catalogs.php
